ESG Mascot
70‘Captain Aer’ surpassed strong competition to be selected to represent AerCap’s ESG initiatives
© 2021 AerCap  |Confidential property of the company, not for disclosure or use without permission
In October, AerCap invited 
children from local schools and children of AerCap employees to participate in our ESG Art Competition
Over 25 children 
participated in the 
challenge, to design and 
name a mascot to 
represent AerCap’s ESG 
initiatives
The winning entry, chosen from the six finalists (left), was the mascot “Captain Aer,” an Irish swallow which is a symbol of freedom and fast and efficient flightThe winner, Jodie Byrne, 
11 years of age, is a 
student at Catherine 
McAuley N.S. in Dublin. 
This is a special school 
for children with severe 
presentation of dyslexia
